page.title: 12Yeovil Livestock Market
page.content:
Last Friday we went to the cattle market.The cows we saw included black & white Friesian,white faced Hereford, & an all black Aberdeen Angus with no horns,(we were told that they make the best beef).The dairy cattle are mostly Friesian,or Jersey (which produce the richest milk).On Mondays,fat sheep & cattle, & pigs & calves,are auctioned.
There are 3 sale rings where animals are auctioned. In 1,store cattle (for farm stock). In 2,barren cows (for meat). In 3,dairy cows. About 200 barren cows were sold that day and that is typical.They fetched between Â£450 and Â£700,depend- ing on weight.The bidding was very fast.The cows were very cramped in their pens & we felt very sorry for them.
